node.title: After 'Miss M Roberts' sat for an Archibald portrait almost 90 years ago, her story was forgotten â€” until recently
node.alt: A photo of a pastel painting of a woman's face.
node.description: Usually, the mystery of a painting is in who painted it, but this time it was the model in a Great Depression-era masterpiece that eluded experts until a father and daughter team figured it out.
node.content:
["It's been almost 90 years since a \"radical\" modernist depiction of a\u00a0'Miss\u00a0M Roberts' was part of\u00a0an iconic Australian painting competition.", "Over the decades,\u00a0her story, along with her first name,\u00a0was forgotten, but a curious curator's investigation has shed light on how her portrait came to be painted.", "The search for answers began as Natalie Wilson prepared to launch an exhibition of 100 Archibald portraits celebrating the prize's 100th birthday.", "While the subjects in 99 of the portraits had been identified, the story behind the blonde-haired woman softly looking out from 'Miss M Roberts' was a mystery.", "That one outlier bothered Ms Wilson, head curator of Archie 100: A Century of the Archibald Prize, no end.", "\"When the exhibition opened there was just one work where I didn't know who the actual subject was because we only had a title for the work, which was a 'Miss M Roberts' by Grace Crowley,\" Ms Wilson said.", "It was hardly enough\u00a0of a clue to take her on a trail of discovery, she said.", "
Inscription on back of drawing a key detail
", "As the exhibition continued, Ms Wilson resigned herself to the fact Miss M Roberts would forever remain a mystery.", "But then, about a month ago, as the portraits were boxed and moved to their next destination in Geelong, Ms Wilson was flicking through a catalogue from an old South Australian exhibition.", "On a list of artworks, one name caught her eye \u2014 'Miss Roberts'. That\u00a0work was dated 1933 \u2014\u00a0the same year Crowley painted her own Miss M Roberts\u00a0portrait.", "", "
Natalie Wilson is still searching for missing Archibald Prize portraits.\u00a0(ABC\u00a0News: Kevin Diallo)
", "Ms Wilson tracked down the drawing and on the back was an inscription: 4 Corona Rd, Waverley.", "She enlisted her father \u2014 a \"genius\" with tracing family trees\u00a0\u2014\u00a0to investigate.", "\"He\u00a0came back to me with some information: on the 1933 Commonwealth electoral roll for Wentworth was a Roberts\u00a0family at 6 Corona Avenue, Waverley.\"", "The list of family members included a\u00a0Marjorie Marie Roberts described as an 'artist model'.", "", "
A visitor views Grace Crowley's\u00a01933 painting of Marjorie Roberts\u00a0at\u00a0the Geelong Gallery.(ABC News: Rachel Clayton)
", "The pair delved into Marjorie's past and found out she was born in New Zealand and was the granddaughter of banker Melnotte Roberts, who fought the Boxer Rebellion in China and founded the Manly Surf Life Saving Club.", "And she wasn't the only model in the family.", "A portrait of her great-grandfather, Sydney pub owner\u00a0Charles Roberts, is hanging in the National Portrait Gallery.", "Marjorie's sister Pamela Meyers,\u00a0now 100 years old, told Ms Wilson Marjorie became a model to help the family during the height of the Great Depression.", "The theory is that Marjorie was recruited as a model while working as a hostess at the Liberty Theatre in Sydney, dressed in movie costumes to beckon customers.", "The theatre was just a few blocks from Dorrit Black's Modern Art Centre \u2014 named after a woman who pioneered modernism in Australia.", "She modelled not only for Crowley, but also Black, as well as for\u00a0Archibald winner Arthur Murch's 'The idle hour'.", "", "
'The idle hour', 1933, by Arthur Murch also features Marjorie Roberts.(Supplied:\u00a0AGNSW)
", "
Family link to the Archibald endures
", "In a poetic turn of events, Ms Wilson was able to track down Mary Larnach-Jones, an artist who has entered the Archibald prize a number of times and is Marjorie's daughter-in-law.", "", "
Marjorie Roberts' daughter-in-law\u00a0Mary Larnach-Jones is an artist.(ABC News: Rachel Clayton)
", "Mrs Larnach-Jones said her mother-in-law was \"larger than life\".", "\"I'm not surprised she would have been popular as an artist model,\" she said.", "Geelong Gallery curator Lisa Sullivan, who is overseeing the city's hosting of the Archibald centenary, said the exhibition marked a homecoming of sorts.", "\"There is a very interesting connection between J.F.\u00a0Archibald and Geelong.\u00a0He was born here in Geelong West in 1856,\" she said.", "", "
Lisa Sullivan says Geelong is the only place in Victoria where people can visit the Archie 100 exhibition.\u00a0(ABC News: Rachel Clayton)
", "Ms Sullivan added that after hearing about Marjorie's life and personality she was not surprised Crowley was attracted to such a \"dynamic sitter\".", "\"It would have been quite radical in 1933 for such a modernist painting to be included in the Archibald Prize.\"", "While Ms Wilson has tracked down 1,700 portraits entered into the Archibald Prize over the decades, there are thousands more which could be hiding in dusty rooms around the world.", "\"I\u00a0don't go anywhere now if I see a portrait without looking up the database to see if it's an Archibald piece,\" she said.", "Anyone keen to catch a glimpse of Miss Roberts' likeness all these years later\u00a0has until February to visit the exhibition."]
